definition: ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations

sentences.english: After this, I want to show you to the Haunted House.
sentences.chinese: 在這之後，我想帶你鬼屋。

sentences.english: Welcome to the first CarnEVIL party at Circus Barbarossa.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎來到芭芭露莎第一屆鬼屋嘉年華萬聖節派對。

sentences.english: Airline executives should rush to the Haunted Mansion in the Magic Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 航空公司的經理們應該直接衝向魔幻世界的鬼屋。

sentences.english: As temperatures soar, Japanese turn to ghost houses.
sentences.chinese: 遭遇最熱夏季日本人“鬼屋”創意消暑。

sentences.english: Today, l was crouched on the ground in the doorway at a haunted mansion.
sentences.chinese: 今天我在鬼屋門口的地板上趴着。

sentences.english: Knowing their house was haunted sent shivers up and down my spine.
sentences.chinese: 知道他們的房子是鬼屋之後，我感到脊背發涼。

sentences.english: Jocelyn: Of course, but before that, you have to go to the Haunted House with me.
sentences.chinese: 當然，但在那之前，你得先跟我一起去鬼屋。

sentences.english: This was the only equipment he took to haunted houses.
sentences.chinese: 他就只攜帶這種相機拜訪各地的鬼屋。

sentences.english: They've added four haunted houses and three museums.
sentences.chinese: 他們新添了四棟鬼屋和三個博物館。

sentences.english: Welcome to the first CarnEVIL party at Circus 2416bar.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎來到2416部落第一屆鬼屋嘉年華萬聖節派對。

definition: form of divination similar to the Ouija board, in which participants use their forefingers to push a small saucer over a sheet of paper inscribed with numerous Chinese characters
a form of automatic writing in which two or more participants hold a single pen over a sheet of paper and invite a spirit to write answers to their questions/a spirit so invited
